Description: Red-grey pottery ostracon, from the body of a vessel, exterior grooved and covered with a buff-coloured slip, with remains of 4 lines of demotic text in black ink on the exterior.
Curator's comments: This ostracon yields a so-called r-rḫ=w ("that which was measured") text. These texts, all originating from the Thebaid in the Ptolemaic and early-Roman period, were issued to farmers after a measurement of their cultivated land had been conducted in order to determine due amounts of harvest tax.
